@Crzyrndm today I tried to use Pilot Assistant with a stock turboprop plane, but it didn't work at all, it just locked me out of my own steering input. All I wanted it to do was give me a straight and steady 0.5m/s climbrate Turboprops depends on physical interaction (wahey! ) between two crafts to work, so CoT/CoM/CoL are all misrepresented by their indicators (cos they only account for one component craft without the weight/lift/thrust of the other). Would that be affecting Pilot Assistant somehow? Any workaround you can suggest?

Edited November 27, 2016 by The_Rocketeer

PA only depends on the flight characteristics (heading, vertical speed, etc.) of the vessel, so it should handle a seperated vessel component without issue. It *may* be attempting to control the incorrect vessel in which case switching vessels to the other vessel and then back again should rectify the issue (when you switch, PA defaults to controlling the vessel you switched to).

Otherwise, I'm going to need more information.

@Crzyrndm I believe I have solved the issue. I am ashamed.

I hadn't raised the landing gear.

Is it possible to make sure that the Asst. window can't be dragged offscreen?

I just had to restart my game after editing the mod's settings file to put it back onscreen;
I'd apparently grabbed hold of the window when turning my camera and flung it way off to -1000x -1000y.
Thank you very much for this mod!  Just what I needed for those long polar resupply runs!

I recently downloaded this mod as well as dynamic deflection, and tested them out yesterday. Yaw and Roll, Pitch, and Throttle Control all worked perfectly (maintained pitch, speed, and level flight). I started up KSP today and wanted to try and see if the pilot assistant would work after I decoupled a smaller aircraft from a larger one. I took off and then once at altitude turned on the PA to maintain altitude, speed, and bank (level flight), which it did perfectly. 

Then I decoupled the docking port holding both craft together, switched craft from the mother ship to the small aircraft, and tried to edit speed and altitude inputs. PA however did not alter any control surfaces or the throttle. I turned PA off and then saw the mother ship go into a hard left bank and dive, so I reverted to the SPH. Figuring that PA couldn't work with one craft becoming two, I decided to fly another plane. Before takeoff I set Yaw and Roll to hold level. As my wheels lifted off the runway, without any keyboard input from me, the ailerons deflected and I went into a hard right roll. I then tried again with PA Yaw and Roll control turned off and the same thing happened.

I uninstalled both Pilot Assistant and Dynamic Deflection, launched the game, took off in the second aircraft, and everything flew normally. I then reinstalled Pilot Assistant and Dynamic Deflection. I attempted to take off without any of the PA aids on, but when my wheels left the ground I went into a hard right bank just like before.

I really would like to fix this because it was working beautifully yesterday. Any advice on how to fix this would be wonderful. Thank you.

@HadrianRomulus

Apologies for the (very) late reply. Hectic few months and a bit of burnout have not kept KSP at the top of my todo list. Latest release of dynamic deflection should resolve the roll issues and I will be looking into the vessel management code shortly (in the meantime, you can probably fix this issue by switching away from the seperated vessel and then back quickly. The core issue is that it's giving you the UI for the incorrect vessel after separation)
